discussion.content: Using tracert you'll be able to determine where exactly the packet is being dropped, right before reaching the gateway router, right before reaching one of the DNS servers, or maybe before the WAN servers for the website
Question asks to "determine where the issue is located". A, B, C all are solutions, D is the only one that can find where the issue is.

comments.content: Correction answer is D to indicate where the packets are dropped.

discussion.content: Answer is A, default gateway must be in the same range as the host IP.

choices.D: Perform a tracert command to locate where the packet is dropped.
choices.A: Modify the default gateway address and ping the server to test connectivity.
choices.B: Change the DNS servers to be on the same subnet as the host.
choices.C: Modify the router's ACL to allow port 80 to exit the network.

discussion.content: I don't have a great explanation but I can tell that I use a TFTP application to update firmware on switches. It is the only way I know how to do it. Believe me when I say it works.
Tftp is set up on your computer and then remotely accessed on your router or switch to transfer files/back up data typically using the CLI.
Any explanation why it is TFTP?

comments.content: Key here is "downloaded TO the device" not "ON the device." That takes SSH and Telnet out of the question. RDP can be used to download it ON the device, but TFTP is left as the most reasonable answer.
What was the give away for me was the fact that TFTP (Trivial File Transfer Protocol) is a file transfer protocol and the update will be be a file. The rest are remote connection protocol

questions.question_text: A network technician is performing a firmware upgrade on a switch. The firmware needs to be downloaded to the device. Which of the following methods should the technician use to retrieve the updated firmware?

A network technician is assisting a user who is experiencing connectivity problems with the VPN. The technician has confirmed the VPN is functioning and other users at the site cannot access the Internet. Which of the following commands would MOST likely be used to further troubleshoot?

discussion.content: use tracert to find exactly where the connection is being droped

questions.question_text: Which of the following MUST be installed on an employee's computer if the remote access VPN implements an SSL VPN with PKI authentication?

discussion.content: the public key can only be decrypted y the private key, so the employee PC will send the public key of which it only has the private key, and the server will encrypt the file with the same public key, and which is to later be decrypted at the employees PC with the private key it only owns.

Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) is a technology for authenticating users and devices in the digital world. The basic idea is to have one or more trusted parties digitally sign documents certifying that a particular cryptographic key belongs to a particular user or device. ... These documents are called certificates.
port 23 Telnet, used for accessing system remotely and port 22 will be SSH

questions.question_text: Which of the following default ports should be opened on a firewall to allow for SSH and Telnet? (Choose two.)
